questions.question: Chemical reactions rearrange atoms, but do not create or destroy them.
Molybdenum has an atomic number of 42. Several common isotopes exist, with mass numbers from 92–100. Which of the following can be true?
possible_answers: Molybdenum atoms can have between 50 and 58 neutrons.
Molybdenum atoms can have between 50 and 58 protons.
Molybdenum atoms can have between 50 and 58 electrons.
Isotopes of molybdenum have different numbers of electrons.
questions.correct_answer: Molybdenum atoms can have between 50 and 58 neutrons.

questions.question: Hydrophobic substances such as vegetable oil are ____.
possible_answers: nonpolar substances that repel water molecules
polar substances that repel water molecules
nonpolar substances that have an attraction for water molecules
polar substances that have an affinity for water
questions.correct_answer: nonpolar substances that repel water molecules

questions.question: The uncharged component in the core of an atom is a(n) ____.
From its atomic number of 15, it is possible to predict that the phosphorus atom has ____.
When the atoms involved in a covalent bond have the same electronegativity, what type of bond results?
Atoms have no electric charge because they have ____.
possible_answers: an equal number of protons and electrons
an equal number of protons and neutrons
an equal number of charged and uncharged subatomic particles
questions.correct_answer: an equal number of protons and electrons

questions.question: Electrons are found ____.
possible_answers: in one or more shells that surround the atom's nucleus
in the nucleus of an atom
in both the nucleus and inner shell of an atom
questions.correct_answer: in one or more shells that surround the atom's nucleus

questions.question: An atom is in its most stable state when all its electron shells are filled to capacity.
Oil and water do not mix together well because ____.
possible_answers: water is polar and oil is nonpolar
water has hydrogen bonds and oil is polar
only identical molecules of the same chemical can mix together easily
water and oil are covalently bonded together
questions.correct_answer: water is polar and oil is nonpolar

questions.question: The sum of an atom's protons and neutrons is its ____.
An atom that becomes charged due to the gain or loss of an electron is called a(n) ____.
Ionic bonds ____.
possible_answers: form between atoms that develop opposite charges
result from the sharing of electrons between atoms
result from the natural repulsion that develops between protons
questions.correct_answer: form between atoms that develop opposite charges

questions.question: Chemists often represent the structure of atoms using p, n, and e to indicate numbers of protons, neutrons, and electrons; which atom would have an atomic mass number of 30?
Carbon-14 has the same ____.
possible_answers: number of protons but more neutrons than carbon-12
atomic mass as both carbon-12 and carbon-13
atomic number and atomic mass as carbon-12
atomic number and thus number of neutrons as carbon-13
questions.correct_answer: number of protons but more neutrons than carbon-12

questions.question: Which statement is true of all atoms that are anions?
possible_answers: The atom has more electrons than protons.
The atom has more protons than electrons.
The atom has fewer protons than a neutral atom of the same element.
The atom has more neutrons than protons.
questions.correct_answer: The atom has more electrons than protons.

questions.question: You are given an unknown substance and asked to determine whether it is polar or nonpolar. The easiest way to do this would be to ____.
possible_answers: determine whether the compound dissolves in water
determine whether the compound is held together by hydrogen bonds
determine the number of electrons in the compound's outer shell
mix the compound with an ionic substance to see whether its bonds can withstand the pressure
questions.correct_answer: determine whether the compound dissolves in water

questions.question: Bonds between two atoms that are equally electronegative are ____.
The left-to-right order of elements in the periodic table is based on their ____.
About 25 of the 92 natural elements are known to be essential to life. Which four make up approximately 96% of living matter?
A proton has ____ charge.
How many electrons are involved in a triple covalent bond?
To increase the rate of a reaction you could ____.
Covalent bonds are formed by ____.
possible_answers: the transfer of valence electrons from one atom to another
the sharing of electrons in the innermost shell
the conversion of ionic bonds to covalent bonds

questions.question: A covalent chemical bond is one in which ____.
possible_answers: outer-shell electrons of two atoms are shared so as to satisfactorily fill their respective orbitals
outer-shell electrons of one atom are transferred to fill the inner shell of another atom
electrons are removed from one atom and transferred to another atom so that the two atoms become oppositely charged
protons and neutrons are shared by two atoms
questions.correct_answer: outer-shell electrons of two atoms are shared so as to satisfactorily fill their respective orbitals
